page.title: 09LIFE IN A TOWER BLOCK 1
page.content: People have different opinions about life in a tower block. There are some bad points such as incidents of vandalism, feelings of loneliness and isolation and children who like to ride in the lifts or rush up and down the stairs. When the lifts are broken elderly people can be isolated at higher levels. Sometimes windows are broken by stones and bottles. Children forget that the flats are homes and not a public building. Some people missed having a garden and being able to step out into their own backyards. One lady described living in a tower block as like living in a box. When she first moved in she suffered from depression owing to loneliness and isolation. She has now made some friends in neighbouring flats and is much happier. The block sways in high winds but no-one notices now.
